lead_paragraph: The Cuban defector Alexei Ramírez, below, is off to a slow start, with one hit and four strikeouts in his first eight at-bats, leaving seven men on base in two losses. But after his strong spring training, the White Sox figure to give him a chance to succeed. At 26 and with Cuban national team experience, he probably would not benefit from time in the minors. Once center fielder Jerry Owens returns from the disabled list, Ramírez figures to pressure Juan Uribe for time at second base. The Sox have already explored Uribe’s trade value by putting him through waivers.
